Generates a spline from a number of input control matrices. The position of the control matrices defines
the shape of the generated spline, while the upper 3×3 transform of the control matrices defines the framing
of the spline. The generated spline is then resampled a variable number of times to produce
output transforms which are made available on the

port. Additional twists can be applied to the
output transforms via the

The output transforms are oriented such that their -Z axis points towards the next sample, and their +Y axis
    matches as closely as possible to the interpolated +Y axis of the control matrices. This behavior is the source
    of some instability and therefore users should favor rig::SplineInterpolateTransforms::2.0 which corrects this
    instability and adds additional flexibility for the user to choose the tangent direction which points towards the
    next sample.

Additional twists (in radians) to add to the output transforms. There does NOT have to be a twist value per cv.
    Adding a value of 0 and 2*M_PI will twist the output transforms a full rotation about transforms' Z axes.
    Additional twists values are interpolated linearly between values across the length of the spline.
The order of the generated spline curve.
When true, adds smooth-step smoothing to the output transforms. The default value is false.

The resampled transforms. The number of connections to this port controls the number of resampled points on the
